page.title: 20THE HAMLET OF PULLEY
page.content: The hamlet of{Pulley}is to the south of{Meole}and the{Rea Brook. Lower {Pulley}Cottages have two terraces of 4 houses. One is{Edward Morris'}house and is 88 years old. Nearby is{Field {House}built in 1795. Opposite are two pairs of semi-detatched, red brick, 195O's houses. In{Lower Pulley Lane}is a long half-timbered barn and{Pulley {Hall,}a farm with a bed & breakfast sign.{Pulley Lane}has a new, two bay- windowed farmhouse belonging to{Pulley {Farm.}Nearby ia an old barn with diamond-shaped ventilation holes in the brickwork.{Ivy House}is a white Victorian House and almost opposite is {Pulley House,}a good-looking Victorian house, set in walled gardens. The land around{Pulley}as far as{Bayston Hill is farmland but soon this peaceful hamlet will have the new{Shrewsbury by-pass running right next to it.
